triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs serve as the core cognitive component ('brain') of the autonomous medical agents used in Agent Hospital.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: The paper extends intelligent agent concepts by proposing LLM-powered autonomous agents for medical roles (patients, nurses, doctors).

triples.name: Artificial intelligence in healthcare
triples.relevance: Agent Hospital applies AI to the medical domain by simulating the complete hospital treatment process.

triples.name: United States Medical Licensing Examination
triples.relevance: The MedQA benchmark uses USMLE test questions to evaluate the evolved doctor agents' medical knowledge.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Agent Hospital is a multi-agent system where patients, nurses, and doctors are independent LLM-powered agents interacting in a simulated hospital environment.

triples.name: Medical simulation
triples.relevance: Agent Hospital proposes a novel hospital simulacrum as a training method for evolving medical agents without manual data labeling.

triples.name: Training simulation
triples.relevance: The paper employs simulation-based training where doctor agents learn through treating thousands of patient agents over extended simulated interactions.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Agent evolution in the simulacrum enables doctor agents to improve performance through learning from experience, similar to reinforcement learning principles.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: NLP capabilities are fundamental to how LLM-powered medical agents understand patient symptoms and generate diagnostic and treatment decisions.
